Tables (draft)

  • To create an accessible table, the top row of column headers (th) are placed in a thead. Each one receives the scope="col" attribute. The first non-actionable (meaning that doesn't contain a checkbox or menu) column in each row should be marked as a th with a scope="row" attribute.

WCAG 2.0 Guidelines

1.1.1 Non-text Content: All non-text content that is presented to the user has a text alternative that serves the equivalent purpose (some exceptions). (Level A)

Note: If non-text content is pure decoration, is used only for visual formatting, or is not presented to users, then it does not need text alternatives.

Info and Relationships - Information, structure, and relationships conveyed through presentation can be programmatically determined or are available in text.

Meaningful Sequence - When the sequence in which content is presented affects its meaning, a correct reading sequence can be programmatically determined.
